alert.note: Alert for Chester; Union; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Chester, western York and southeastern Union Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 340 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of Union to 13 miles northwest of VC Summer Nuclear Station. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... York, Chester, Rock Hill, Newport, Lockhart, Carlisle, Mcconnells, Richburg, Lowrys and Chester State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.
